name: EPIC Hotel - a Kimpton Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the Miami EPIC on 11/01/13. We arrived at 11:00 and we were able to check in early. We also were upgraded to the club level. Everyone was very accommodating. We stayed prior to a cruise. This will be our go to hotel every time we sail out of Miami. This location is within walking distance to nice restaurants and shopping.
reviews.title: Great time at the EPIC Kimpton
Not so EPIC!
reviews.text: I was looking forward to my stay here since I had read so many good reviews. Unfortunately I was disappointed!

reviews.title: All good at the EPIC Kimpton
reviews.text: Failed to accommodate us in the following:

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Checked in at 5pm -luggage was finally brought up after 9pm!!
reviews.title: Skeptical, but ended up being Awesome!
Good location downtown
reviews.text: 2. Small fridge request - also brought in after 9pm!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a really nice view, and everything is clean and classy. I went to visit the JW Marriot which is just across the street, and definitely prefer Epic. You just can feel this young, fresh, modern atmosphere more at the Epic. What I remember the most was the food that I ordered to my room. It was just Bolognese Spaghettis, a glass of wine and a Chocolate Pudding, but oh dear it was absolutely tasteful and perfect. The staff is also great. Definitely would stay again.
reviews.title: EPIC stay!

reviews.text: Every time I stay at this hotel, I like it more. Don't know if it is the unstated elegance and classy decor, the vibrant atmosphere fueled by the seemingly endless throngs of people looking happy and relaxed or the location itself, ensconced in the canal and surrounded by beautiful buildings. The rooms are spacious, tastefully decorated and clean. The staff is elegant and polite and the views are outstanding. Staying here is indeed an EPIC experience.
reviews.title: An EPIC Experience
Great stay very accommodating
reviews.text: Stayed here a couple times I got checked in by the same guy both times I stayed here Mallik is great he remembered me from the first time I stayed here. He was very thorough and personable. He went over everything step by step and made it very easy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Love the wine hour perk as well. When I went to grab a glass who was there to greet me with a glass of sangria? Mallik once again. Great service like all the kimpton properties.
reviews.title: Excellent stay on 29th floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed on the floor that allowed full access to the concierge lounge, which offered light tapas-style meals 5 times a day (hot breakfast, lunch, mid-day snack, hot dinner and evening dessert), along with a full open bar with premium brands. If you are a light eater, you could eat here without having to pay to go to any restaurants, which is tough, given the great options in Miami. The concierges were friendly and helpful, to the point of having a personalized list of weekly activities and restaurants, created based on feedback from other guests. Our suite had a wonderful view of the water and skyline. The hotel is located within a 12-minute cab ride to South Beach, and a 15-minute ride from the airport. It was a short walk to the local touristy market, as well as to the Brickell area, which we were told is a trendy option for locals who do not want the South Beach experience. There are also café style restaurants within 5 blocks walking distance, and without having to wait for the draw bridge over the waterways. We were also very happy to see that there was a scale in the bathroom; the only other place we ever saw this was the Trump penthouse in Las Vegas and the Rosewood in Vancouver. We would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Little Find

reviews.text: The reviews here on TripAdvisor made the decision to book the Epic pretty easy, and they didn't disappoint. I'm not sure what else I can add --- I experienced the same fabulous service, beautiful room, and overall top-notch feel of the place that everyone else has. I wish the lobby level lounge had been open, but otherwise was completely satisfied. I'd definitely go back.
reviews.title: Believe the #1 Ranking Here....It's Fabulous.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have returned from a quick trip to FL and stayed in this hotel whilst in MIA. The hotel is very nice and staff very professional. it well deserves the number one spot
reviews.title: VERY NICE all true what they say

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used this hotel as a pre cruise hotel, think cost maybe £360 ish for the night, worth every penny, we booked club level, 30th floor, waterside views, absolutely stunning. We arrived midday, straight to the pool where we were greeted with complimentary wine, wine and more wine. The pool area was gorgeous. Then up to shower and get ready for the evening ahead, we went into the club lounge, which had an open well stocked bar (premium drinks),(complimentary) and a selection of delicious food,(complimentary) we sat on the balcony outside until dark, it was fantastic and we wanted for nothing. The next day, we went to breakfast in the club lounge (again complimentary) and had champagne and OJ. smoked salmon, cream cheese and capers (yum what a combination)there was lots of other stuff, again sat on the balcony and watch the world go by. (Fanatastic) I didn't want to leave. ( in fact other than tipping, we struggled to spend money, EVERYTHING on club level was complimentary. As the Americans say, AWESOME hotel. Check out and taxi to the port was immediate. Definitely will go again.... Well done Epic, you've got it right.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel, breathtaking views of The Bay, treated like royalty!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took my spouse to the Epic to celebrate a special birthday. Her priority was a great view from her balcony and they delivered.. I recommend Room 3003.
reviews.title: An Epic Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For her birthday, they gave her flowers and a birthday cake without our asking.
reviews.title: Almost perfect

reviews.text: Arrived at the hotel and was greeted by a very friendly staff and desk clerk. Got room on the 25th floor with an outstanding view. Hotel was recently updated with a modern chic flare. Tons of restaurants and bars are walking distance from the hotel. Port of Miami is only about 2 miles away ($12 cab ride). Great location when heading out on a cruise ship. Internet was included in the room. Pool was on the 15th floor and was mostly adults, but some kids were there playing too. Our room was very quiet all night despite there being a wedding party on our floor. Concierge had a cab waiting to take us to the port in the morning despite there being restrictions because of the triathlon being in town. We would stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel Close to the Port of Miami
Wonderful Experience
reviews.text: I can't say enough about my time here and this hotel. What a great staff. Extremely helpful. At check in Aubrey was a bright ray of sunshine on a blustery day. She seemed to look after us all day. The gym was excellent. Dinner at Zuma was also great.

reviews.title: Very disappointed and won't return.
reviews.text: I'll definitely be back!

We were so disappointed in our stay. We requested a king bed 30 days before our arrival but when we arrived, no king bed available. Reported blaring loud tv in adjoining room to front desk but no action taken to reduce noise at 11:30 PM. Room conditions and amenities were substandard for this type of property. Too many other quality hotels to select from so skip this place!
reviews.title: The Epic Hotel is SO EPIC!!!!

reviews.text: Recently stayed at the epic hotel in miami for what was to originally be 2 nights before a cruise. After a delayed flight and getting in at 3:30am we were greeted by Mercedes who was kind and so welcoming to us. The night before the cruise my mum took very sick which required an ambulance to the hospital. The hotel staff were exceptional. Having to cancel the cruise due to ill health, the hotel did everything they could to accommodate our stay for the extra 4 nights. Nothing was too difficult and they certainly came to the party in our time of need. No words can express our gratitude. The Epic will be forever engraved in our minds as THE hotel. We have stayed at some fantastic hotels over our 6 trips across the usa, but the Epic is hands down our favourite for both supreme quality and the empathy shown by its staff. Personal thanks to Mercedes and Anna, but a big thanks to the Epic team.
reviews.title: Beautiful rooms, downtown location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a corner suite on the club level. The suite was fabulous, decorated in a tasteful minimalist modern fashion. Its main balcony overlooked the Miami river estuary and Biscayne bay. There was always some activity on the water to capture your attention.
reviews.title: Gorgeous new hotel in downtown Miami

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Without exception, the hotel staff were warmly friendly and eager to do our bidding. The club lounge supplied five separate feedings each day, which were ample to provide breakfast and a light lunch. The open bar was kept well-stocked evenings with premium brands such as Hennesy cognac and Glynfiddich whiskey.
reviews.title: Excellent is an Understatement Here!!

reviews.text: We ate several times at the Area 31 restaurant in the hotel. The food was tasty and nicely presented, but we felt the menu was way too heavy on fish and lacking on other entrees. The Marriott across the street and the Hyatt a block away had decent restaurants within easy walking distance.
reviews.title: Great trip, found Epic through tripadvisor

reviews.text: One major problem arose: When I initially called to make our reservation, the person at the Kimpton reservation center refused to honor the "3rd day free" promotion advertised on the hotel's web site, and I had to email the Epic's manager to get that rate. Then, the person making the actual reservation asked for my credit card number via unsecured email. I declined, attempted to call her without success and finally completed the reservation with the Eic's front desk staff. Weeks later, I called to add a room for guests of ours, and discovered that our reservation had been cancelled! Fortunately, a very pleasant manager at the reservations center reinstated the reservation and all went well afterwards.
reviews.title: Stunning hotel in heart of Downtown Miami

reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Epic and are making plans to return. A suggestion for the hotel, though: Put in a sundries shop (magazines, candy, etc) . Currently there is none, and the only alternative is to walk to a nearby hotel for what you need.
reviews.title: Couldn't have been much better

reviews.text: I went to the Epic with my division for a few days in October. All in all, it was a very good experience. The rooms are VERY nice and big and NEW and all have balconies - at the end of a stressful day of work this was a welcome escape. We enjoyed the pool and the bars/restaurants, too. The conference facility itself, though, was really the best part (I realize this sounds funny but read on). After years of sitting in awful boardrooms with low ceilings and no natural light, this big, airy room was exactly what we needed. It changed the entire mood of the event to have actual airflow, to be able to step outside on a break, etc. And the food was fantastic. The only drawback was that apparently the place had had some flooding issues or something so part of the hotel was closed. I'm sure they've sorted this out by now. And the location, while not in South Beach, is fine, especially for a work-related trip (kept everyone a little more focused on the job at hand). Was about a $10 cab ride into South Beach. It's also pet friendly! After having stayed there, as well as staying at some crumbly old hotels on South Beach, I think I might even stay there again on a non-work-related trip.
reviews.title: Great place for a conference

reviews.text: Just returned from the Miami Boat Show.. We have stayed in many 5 star hotels, however the customer service at the Epic, exceeds any hotel we have ever stayed in. From the front desk to the club level, it was first class all the way.. We had forgotten our phone chargers and called to see if they had a spare we could borrow, and an employee came right upstairs and GAVE us his.. We told him we wanted to borrow it to charge our phones and he insisted we keep his. The club level was worth every penny. Mark was the absolute best and made our trip worthwhile.. He even offered to print out an itinerary with the best restaurants, clubs, entertainment for our next trip... I have never encountered this level of consistent customer service, not to forget how comfortable and quiet the rooms were as well as the excellent dining... Will definitely be back.. 5 stars all the way
reviews.title: Incredible

reviews.text: We chose the Epic hotel based on trip advisors reviews. We have been to South beach and wanted a different location just before our cruise. We had three nights water view club level. Amazing staff, amazing view and a good location. The one miss was the club level experience. The staff in the club level went out of their way to make it enjoyable....with what they had to work with. Always behind the eight ball....always rushed and under staffed. Never on time setting up the meal presentations. The food ??? If you have stayed at Ritz Carlton club level.......not even close. We paid extra for the club experience and was truly let down. I feel if we had not been in the club level the hotel would of been perfect. Get this figured out quickly and perfect score!!!
reviews.title: Stay out of the club level

reviews.text: I stayed at the Epic while attending a conference. The rooms are decorated in a simple, modern style and are lovely. Mine (on the 27th floor) had a generously sized balcony with a beautiful view of the bay and the hotel's pools below. Improving on a few "little things" would take a good hotel to great: put a coffee maker in the room; audit the room before a guest checks in--mine was missing a luggage rack and I had to ask them to bring one; when someone orders a $45 room service dinner, don't make them beg for a glass of ice water, then bring them a tiny 4 oz. bottle of water; when you know your hotel is sold out, hire enough valets so the place isn't chaos, with your guests' cars sitting there completely unattended with the keys in and cars running (when I brought this to the manager's attention, he took care of it immediately and comped my parking charge, which I appreciated); perhaps most importantly, when a guest smokes near someone else who is eating in your restaurant, in violation of Miami's anti-smoking ordinance, MAKE THEM STOP.
reviews.title: Great Place Overall, But Misses on the Little Things

reviews.text: This really is a lovely hotel and it would be very easy to fix these things.
reviews.title: Very nice !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ok, I am a big fan of the more intimiate guesthouse/bb type hotels... EPIC is grand, huge, luxorious and yet still a boutique. The staff was awesome and the service we encountered was impeccable (specifically by the pool),.. we were constantly getting water refills and even got some fruitkabobs.
reviews.title: EPIC Staycation

reviews.text: The rooms were comfy, cozy and the beds were cloudlike. I loved that although it was a city view, once you closed the sliding door all of the noise disappeared. :)
reviews.title: A bit disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The ONLY negative is the overnight parking... @ $32... THATS INSANE! Guests should be able to park for free... afterall, they are spending money in your hotel...
reviews.title: EPIC rating for an EPIC hotel - Wonderful!

reviews.text: Area 31 Breakfast was good and plentiful :)
reviews.title: Absolutely Fab

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During check-in, the front desk was pretty impatient; so we gave up trying to get an upgrade to a room at the club level. The janitors are friendlier than that receptionist. Our water-view king premier room is good in size and has good sound-proof features that shields away both street and hallway sounds. However, it lacks common amenity supplier such as mouth wash and shower cap. Parking is $32 per night but getting a valet has been difficult early in the morning. The gym equipments are moved to the Kid’s room which is a bit small and crowded.
reviews.title: Outstanding!!

reviews.text: Stayed in room 2431 for three nights. Two double beds. Nice sized room with good light. Check-in was easy and v. friendly. Room has a small, private balcony (no view).
reviews.title: Wonderful staff, good property, kill the mini bar

reviews.text: Good sleep quality and I didn't hear any doors slamming in the night or neighbor noise. With balcony door open it was too noisy - cars honking nonstop. (Why are you all honking? The traffic is not moving. Just shush.)
reviews.title: Sadly only one night
Beautiful hotel, subpar service
reviews.text: I had room service four times (so so and not a lot of options 24/7) and went to pool bar for a cocktail. It was super windy while I was there, so just took in the view and departed. It would be an awesome spot in good weather.
I'm a fan of Kimptons, very good value for the money. My stay was overall v. good with a few minor points that would have made it perfect.
reviews.title: Chic & exciting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Good:
reviews.title: EPIC

reviews.text: Stayed here for our anniversary with teenage sons as part of vacation to Florida.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: Upgraded to Club lounge which was fabulous value, with excellent breakfast, fresh foods and drinks served throughout the day. Staff were exceptionally friendly and polite and went out of their way to make our vacation special. Concierge staff had a wealth of knowledge of the area, restaurants, places to visit - thank you to Andrew, Gene and Oskar. Staff in the restaurant Area 31 and Club lounge spoilt us with their attentiveness and thank you to Rachel and Fellipe for making our trip so special and memorable. Could not recommend this hotel enough. Can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay!!

reviews.text: I was in town on business and had the pleasure of staying at the Epic. Fantastic experience!
reviews.title: Return Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was top notch. Amenities were beautifully done ( I was staying on the Club level). Cannot recommend it highly enough!
reviews.title: Best Customer Service ever

reviews.text: The Epic was a nice Hotel. Wonderful view, great service, clean room. Way too loud though. Club in the lobby was loud, bridge was loud. We were charged for drinks we did not drink out of the bar. Once I called and explained that we did not drink them, they were removed from our bill but it was a pain to have that done. It should have never happened. The room service was average and the cost was very high. There were not very many simple places to eat around the Epic. For us traveling through, it was really out of our way.
reviews.title: Valet experience

reviews.text: I stayed at the Epic Hotel in Miami this past weekend, and it was amazing!! The hotel is beautiful, and the staff was very courteous & accommodating. I also found the hotel to be in a great location...very close to the beaches and Mary Brickell Village. If I ever decide to stay in downtown Miami again, it will be the Epic!! I can't wait to go back!!
reviews.title: Weekend Get-Away

reviews.text: We are sold on Kimpton and this property was no different. Beautiful, comfortable and great location ( we didn't want to stay on South Beach). The pool/cabana area was very nice and we had a great view of Biscayne Bay. One of the best bathrooms ever!!!
reviews.title: Another great Kimpton property!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent option, needs a little more in the hotel eating options, more considering that Zuma is always packed. And rooms near the 16, 17 and 18 floors can receive a lot of noise on happy hours friday. For the rest, everything was great.
reviews.title: Excellent Option

reviews.text: Family of 4 from Norway (children 3 and 7 years)
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, but I would have chosen another hotel

reviews.text: Let me first clarify that this is a very nice hotel, modern, spacious, nicely furnished and clean rooms, and you have a good view. We lived in 21 floor and had views of the city, but parts of the view was limited by nearby high-rise buildings. Check-in went quickly and those who worked the front desk was very friendly. But for us, this hotel is a little too formal and "poche". Picolo who took the luggage to the room, and if you want to park on site, this is a service where they park the car for you, and this costs $ 36 extra per day. Delivery and pickup of the car also took some time as there were several who were waiting for the same service. The hotel has a pool area on the roof of 16 floor, but because there were signs of rain didn't they allowed us to swim, something we had looked forward to after a long car trip. The hotel is located downtown, so there is a long distance to Miami Beach where there is most to see for tourists. It should be noted that the Bayside Mall is only a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel and we enjoyed ourselves here in the evening. All in all a very nice hotel, but as a family, we had chosen a less "poche" hotel on Miami beach with the ability to swim in the sea.
reviews.title: Not my favorite 4 star hotel but I would still return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed weekend August 10-12 while attending weekend games at Marlins Park. Granted very early check in we fly red eye from LAX. Staff couldn't be more hospitable and we have great waterfront king room on high floor. Well equipped workout facility at spa open 24 hours with no cost. Free internet as member of Kimpton InTouch program. Great location in downtown Miami, would be a good joint to stay if attending Heat games at AAA. Room was quiet despite downtown location and plenty of activity. While younger crew roams property (lounge open to 5AM on ground floor, Friday night happy hour at Area 31 until 10), all ages welcome at this pet-friendly property. Should be at top of any potential Miami visitor list.
reviews.title: Can't miss property

reviews.text: Recently stayed at the Epic hotel for a quick girls weekend getaway. From check in to check out I can truly say I do not have one complaint about the hotel. The location was great, quick to get to South Beach and everywhere else without the crazy party goers. The service was EPIC. The front desk associate Mari (I think) treated us like friends coming home to visit. Edguardo assisted us to our room and offered every assistance he could. Valet was always on top of things despite the craziness of the patrons coming to enjoy the lounge located in the lobby. The room was top notch and looked exactly as it did on the website. The guest services team was quick and friendly whenever we needed anything. The staff understands what it takes to keep guests happy and I was truly impressed and pleased. I've visited Miami several times but will always stay at the Epic from now on while in town. KUDOS to the management and all the staff!!! A new Epic hotel regular.
reviews.title: EPIC Weekend!!

reviews.text: I thought this was a perfect hotel for my trip to Miami. It's 10 minutes away from Miami International airport which was very convenient. I checked a lil after 10pm on a Tuesday night, and found that Zuma's was still open and had wonderful sushi. The rooms here are very clean and contempory. I really was amazed at how quiet the rooms were and the bedding was wonderful. The next morning I went down to the 16th floor to do some cardio and was quite surprised to see all the equipment and different classes they offered. Went back later that afternoon to participate in yoga class that was a lot of fun blended with locals and hotel guest. The instructor was very knowledgable and helpful. The restaurant Area 31 and the swimming pool is located on this floor as well. I enjoyed the swimming pool as well, with a wonderful view of the bay and Miami river. One of favorite restaurants Capital Grill is directly across the river from the property, which made it nice to walk. I will definetely come back to this location on my next visit.
reviews.title: Perfect Business hotel
Superb !
reviews.text: Just stayed at the Kimpton Epic in Miami... Yet again this establishment comes through with flying colours in every way.. Lobby and the front desk staff were superb, room fantastic and the 16th area is just outstanding.. I haven't been staying at the Kimpton chain much this year, but will do so now after reminding me of what I am missing !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I should preface this review by saying that my husband and I married at this location in March of 2011... however upon our return it was an even better experience.
reviews.title: Second Honeymoon was Spectacular!

reviews.text: I recently stayed at Epic for the weekend and cannot say enough good things to descibe it. The hotel is beautiful, spacious and immaculate. The staff was exceptional, especially Stephanie at the front desk and by the pool, Bea and Lady. They all made our stay perfect. Whatever we needed, they took care of it. I felt as though they went beyond their job decription and it was apparent that they love their job. I will definetely be returning to Epic in the near future! Thank you Epic for making my weekend so enjoyable!
reviews.title: AMAZING!

reviews.text: The weekend of July 26 was a girl's weekend at Epic. It began by being wonderfully greeted at the front desk by Stephanie. It continued to the amazing service of Lady and Bea at the pool. When we decided to eat lunch, we were in luck again with the sweet way of our waiter "A" at Area 31. It was his first day too! Everything was terrific!!!! Food and drink at both area 31 and Zuma were great. I loved the drink Epic sunrise.The staff was top notch. We had a wonderful and relaxing time. I would highly recommend.
reviews.title: Four Star Girls Weekend at Epic Miami

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you travel with your dog(s), I highly recommend the EPIC Hotel! This was our first trip with our two dogs - one 45# and the other 60#. Every hotel we checked either wanted a ridiculous deposit, wouldn't take two dogs, and/or wouldn't take large dogs. Then, we found the EPIC Hotel which not only allowed both dogs but, also didn't ask for a deposit. My partner and I were VERY skeptical since they weren't going to charge us a deposit but, decided to give it a try -- especially since they have special offers for FL residents. WOW! We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived: the staff was extraordinarily courteous, the lobby and rooms were spacious and beautiful, and the food was great! We will definitely stay at this hotel when we visit Miami again.
reviews.title: Dog Friendly Hotel!

reviews.text: This place offers 5 star service at an affordable price! Not only was I blown away by the aesthetic of the hotel and the friendliness of the staff but the dining, SPA services, happy-hour, wine hour and ambience of the hotel were absolutely beyond my expectations. I will most certainly be back again!
reviews.title: AMAZING!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I jumped on the birthday special offer EPIC sent to me, little did I know what was in store for my husband and me. From the moment we pulled our car in the driveway through check-out, we were extraordinarily welcomed, and we are just regular people who love to get away for the weekend. Everything about this hotel is amazing...our room was beyond comfortable with many amenities...there wasn't a need to wonder off the property with the restaurants on site, the pool area, the spa, the rooftop bar...everything. We will definitely return to this fantastic hotel.
reviews.title: Treated like royalty!

description: The new EPIC Hotel is the premier luxury hotel in Miami, a sparkling cosmopolitan destination on the bank of the Miami River where it meets Biscayne Bay. A stunning addition to Miami, this hotel, a Kimpton Hotel, epitomizes urban design while offering guests a level of style and service expected of such a resort. With exceptional amenities, breathtaking views and dining venues like Area 31, EPIC Hotel makes for an unparalleled Miami experience.
